entry.title: Re: How to Send Internal Buyer Email Notification on Good...
entry.content:
Hi Viktor,

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there are multiple supported options to implement internal email notifications to the buyer when a Goods Receipt (GR) is posted for a Purchase Order. The choice depends on how you want to model the requirement and how much flexibility you need.

 

Option 1: Situation Handling ‚Äì Extended Framework

SAP S/4HANA Cloud provides an extended framework for Situation Handling, which allows you to create custom situation use cases based on specific business objects and events.

Using this framework, you can:

  • Model your own situation objects
  • Define events that trigger situations (for example, based on GR-related data)
  • Configure situation pages, including navigation and follow-up actions
  • Define recipients and notification channels, including email

The extended framework is configured using the following apps:

  • Manage Situation Objects: with this app, you can model business objects that enable Situation Handling

Follow the link for instructions:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/d973eb6d464d4dce84f354b9668ef43c.html?locale=en-US

 

  • Manage Situation Scenarios: with this app you can model your own situation scenarios for extended object-based situations.

Follow the link for instructions:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/dfac958be2af4ce79589e8a3eaff88d6.html?locale=en-US

 

  • Manage Situation Types ‚Äì Extended: with this app you create situation templates and types that can be used in the extended framework for Situation Handling

Follow the link for instructions:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/45d60edcf02d409c87076f92

 

Email notifications for your Situation Handling

To enable email notifications for your Situation Handling using the extended framework in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, please follow these steps.

  • Users have Enabled Email Notifications: Users must activate the email notification option in their Fiori Launchpad (user settings profile ‚Üí notifications ‚Üí enable notification email).
  • Define recipients under the Recipients tab in Manage Situation Types ‚Äì Extended. Assign users, teams, or responsibility roles with valid email addresses.
  • Verify that the email notification channel is correctly configured and active in your system. 
  • If needed, customise the notification email format in the Maintain Email Templates app

Below are SAP Community examples that illustrate how to create and adapt your own custom situation types:

  • Custom Situation Handling example
    https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/custom-situation-handling-in-quality-management-get-notified-when-an/ba-p/14277147
  • Custom Situation Cases ‚Äì Configure Your Own Use Cases
    https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/custom-situation-cases-configure-your-own-use-cases-1-6/ba-p/13526769
  • How to Start with Custom Situations ‚Äì High-Level Design
    https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-start-with-custom-situations-high-level-design-of-the-use-case-1-4/ba-p/13578044

 

Option 2: Output Management / Output Parameter Determination for Goods Movement

Another supported approach is to use Output Management for Goods Movement, which allows you to trigger email outputs when a GR is posted.

With this approach, you configure output rules so that when a goods movement (for example, movement type 101 ‚Äì GR for PO) is posted, the system:

  • Creates an output item
  • Sends it via EMAIL to the relevant internal recipient (buyer)

High-level configuration steps

  • Make sure email channel is enabled/available in your tenant (communication + email setup, sender domain, etc., depending on your landscape). 
  • Make sure the buyer/user has a maintained email address in the user master (so the system can actually send to them).
  • Open Output Parameter Determination (OPD) app
  1. Select business document Goods Movement
  2. Create a rule for the relevant GR scenario
  3. Choose EMAIL as the output channel
  4. Maintain recipient determination so it goes to the internal buyer (commonly derived from PO responsibility such as purchasing group/buyer, depending on what fields are available in the rule context

To test the output management, Post a GR (e.g., via Post Goods Receipt for Purchasing Document app) and confirm an output item is created and sent. 

Relevant SAP documentation with instractions:

  • Output Parameter Determination ‚Äì Goods Movement
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/32da8359c8ee4e8b8e8c5e15cacba5aa/b7f02d1514ff4a44b144ea214556fdaf.html
  • Best Practices: Set Up Output Parameter Determination for Goods Movement
    https://help.sap.com/docs/s4hana-best-practices/setting-up-subcontracting-with-sap-business-network-5i2-ef2a4e332ba0803bdfb38670365f8aa7/set-up-output-parameter-determination-for-goods-movement
  • Email configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
    https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/c9b98e682223453b9185d11de90670ac.html

 

Both Situation Handling (Extended) and Output Management for Goods Movement are supported options in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for implementing GR-related email notifications.

Depending on the desired behavior, flexibility, and notification design, you can choose the approach that best fits your business scenario and adopt it accordingly.

 

Best regards,

Elena P.

entry.title: Re: In rebase processing, Units of measure cannot be enab...
entry.content:
Hi, 

 

Units of Measure (UoMs) are language-dependent customizing objects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

While the UoM key is stored in table T006, the corresponding language-dependent descriptions are maintained in table T006A. During Update Business Configuration (CBC activation / rebase), the system performs validation checks in the logon language of the user executing the activation.

 

The affected UoMs exist in the system. However, the language-dependent texts are not maintained in the logon language of the user activating the Business Configuration Set (for example, EN).

Some error messages appear in Chinese (ZH), which might indicate that the UoMs may have been created or imported while the system or user logon language was Chinese, or the UoM texts were never maintained for English (EN).

When CBC attempts to activate customizing object CUNI, the system validates the UoM texts in table T006A for the current logon language. If the corresponding entries are missing, the validation fails and the activation is aborted with errors.

 

Check  UoM Texts in the required language

  1. Navigate to Define Units of Measure (CBC / relevant SSCUI).
  2. For each affected UoM:
    • Maintain the description text in EN (or in the logon language of the user performing the CBC activation).
  3. Save the changes.
  4. Re-run Update Business Configuration.

 

Ensure that UoM texts are maintained in the logon language of the user responsible for activating Business Configuration Sets.

 

Best regards, 

Elena P.

entry.title: Re: Microsoft Teams Integration with SuccessFactors - New 'Home' tab in the SuccessFactors App
entry.content: @akandan It is technically possible to link the SF Test to Teams Prod, however not advisable. And yes, you can unlink the Test, and re-link the Prod in Work Tech Configuration page. Bear in mind if you do that, you will get test data if you have the same user in SF Test and SF Prod, then the user may see some dirty data in Teams, unless you are okay with that. It is always advisable to have two sets of instances connecting to each other, i.e SF Test + Teams Test, SF Prod + Teams Prod.

entry.title: How to pass filters between different stories in SAC
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am currently building several SAC stories, which include an overview story (Story A) and multiple sub-stories (Story B, Story C, and Story D). All these stories share 5 identical filters.

In Story A, I have configured 5 input controls and use the NavigationUtils.openStory script to pass the selected filter values from Story A to Stories B, C, and D. Conversely, I have added hyperlinked buttons in Stories B, C, and D to allow users to jump back to Story A.

Here is the typical user workflow: First, users access Story A, set the required filter values, and then use NavigationUtils.openStory to navigate to the other sub-stories. This script works perfectly well‚Äîit automatically creates corresponding story filters in the target sub-stories and passes the selected filter values accurately.

However, a usability issue arises when users jump back to Story A via the hyperlinked buttons: the previously selected filter values in Story A are lost, and the story reverts to its default filter settings configured during the design phase.

I am wondering if there is a more optimized way to design these stories to enhance the overall user experience.

(If I use NavigationUtils.openStory to jump back to Story A, I think it will recreates story filters for Story A, and then I will lose the possibility to select from different filter values and that is not good.)

Any tips or insights would be appreciated! Thank you in advance!

SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: Re: Reimagining Certification for the Way We Work Today
entry.content:
@DianaRoesner  Hi Diana,
Hope you are doing well

I recently attempted the SAP Certified SAP Sucessfactor Employee center Core and position management certification. This was my first SAP exam and was going to start my SAP career.

However, during the exam I unexpectedly encountered the new Scenario-Based Assessment format. There was no clear indication in the learning journey or preparation materials that the exam format had fundamentally changed from a knowledge-based assessment to an interactive, scenario-driven evaluation.

During the assessment, I was unclear about the expected interaction style  whether I should ask clarifying questions to understand the customer scenario, or directly provide a structured explanation. This was not explained or demonstrated in the training content.

As a result, I was unable to perform effectively in the assessment and lost one certification attempt. This is concerning, as it represents not only the loss of an exam attempt, but also the significant time and effort invested in preparation based on the existing learning materials.

I fully understand and appreciate the intention behind scenario-based assessments. However, if the exam format has changed so substantially, the learning journeys and preparation guidance should also be updated to clearly explain expectations, structure, and evaluation criteria.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Foundational SAP Notes for SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
@Stephan_Heinberg Hi Stephan,

The code split between SAP S/4HANA On-Premise and Private Cloud Edition (PCE) follows SAP‚Äôs S/4HANA Compatibility Scope Matrix, which defines which parts of the on-premise code line are consumable in PCE.

  • S4PEXT 109 contains the backend ABAP layer specific to PCE, including cloud-compatible extensions.

  • UIS4PEXT 109 contains the Fiori frontend content aligned with the PCE scope.

We have summarized the functional differences here in this blog by @jmarquezmr 
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/functional-differences-between-sap-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-and-sap-s/ba-p/13568237

Regards,
Setu

entry.title: Joule Studio: How to Create Document Grounding
entry.content:
Several people have reached out to me this week to describe the new way you set up document grounding with Joule Studio. So here goes.

What is Document Grounding

Many of you may know about Document Grounding, but for those who don't here's a very brief explanation.

  1. The basic way we use AI is to send a prompt to an LLM (a set of "indexed" information).
  2. If we want the LLM to take into account additional information it may not have, we can provide "context" (though the amount of "context" you are allowed to send may be constrained).

One of those pieces of context may come from a set of documents (e.g., housed in SharePoint or in the SAP BTP Object Store service). In order to use those documents as context we must perform Document Grounding, which takes the documents, "chunks" them into small pieces, and then "embeds" them so they can be used as context in our AI requests.

In Joule Studio, when we create agents, we essentially specify an LLM to handle specific types of prompts, and then provide context and instructions for what we want the agent to do.

The "Old" Way in Joule Studio

The old way we performed Document Grounding in Joule Studio was to go into AI Core and create a resource group, connect that resource group to a content store (e.g., the place we store the documents), and have AI Core chunk and embed the documents so we could use the content within an agent or for use when sending a prompt to AI Core. Joule Studio would be configured to connect with a specific AI Core, and the developer of an agent would type in the name of a resource group in AI Core to use with their agent.

Here we can see in the SAP AI Launchpad that we are connected to the "dbw" resource, and we have created a "pipeline" with documents.

If we click inside, we can see that this pipeline has 4 documents, each chunked and embedded. 

But doing this required going into the SAP AI Launchpad, creating Generic Secrets by encoding credentials in Base64, and several more steps in tools we may not be familiar with.

Joule Studio still makes use of the same mechanism in AI Core, but now takes care of creating all the artifacts behind the scene (and enables some new capabilities).  

 

1. Prerequisites

You need an instance of SAP AI Core and an S3-compatible document store such as the Object Store service in BTP. I won't go into setting these up, but you can find out more information here:

  • AI Core
  • Object Store

If you need more information, leave a comment.

Note you can define many instances of AI Core and Object Store to be used with Joule Studio.

 

2. Destinations

You need to set up destinations to AI Core and Object Store on both your SAP Build tenant and your Joule tenant. 

AI Core Destination

Get the service key of your AI Core instance, and create a destination as shown below.

Append /oauth/token to the url value of the service key and use this for the destination's Token Service URL.

Add the additional property sap-joule-studio-document-grounding-ai-core and set it to true. This makes the destination visible within the SAP Build Control Tower.

 

Object Store Destination

Similarly, get the service key for the object store service instance and set the following destination fields with the corresponding service field value:

Destination FieldService Key Field
URLaccess_key_id
Client IDhost (add https://)
Client Secretsecret_access_key
Token Service URLhost (add https://)

Add the following additional properties:

Additional PropertyValue
regionregion value from service key
bucketbucket value from service key
usernameusername value from service key
typeS3
sap-joule-studio-document-grounding-object-store
true

The additional property sap-joule-studio-document-grounding-object-store makes the destination visible within the SAP Build Control Tower.

 

3. Set Up in Control Tower

In the Control Tower, the SAP Build admin will decide:

  • From which object stores to create Document Grounding.
  • In which AI Core instances to create these Document Grounding pipelines.

The Control Tower now has a Joule section, including a Document Grounding tile so the admin can create Document Grounding and make it available to Joule Studio developers.

Click the Document Grounding tile. You can now create sets of Document Grounding.

Note that while in the SAP AI Launchpad you could create different pipelines with different sets of documents in the same resource group, here each object store will create a separate resource group.

Click Add.

Give the resource group a name.

Select the AI Core instance in which to create the resource group.

And finally select the object store whose documents you want to ground.

Click Add.

The status of the resource group will be Pending. 

After about a minute (depending on the size of the documents), the status will change to Completed.

(Early on, I occasionally got Error messages, or Pending simply remained for a long time, and sometimes they would alternate between those messages. In such cases, make sure the destinations are configured properly and make sure the documents in the Object Store are not corrupted.)

If you now look in SAP AI Launchpad, and go to SAP AI Core Administration > Resource Groups, you will see a new resource group whose name is the name you specified (without spaces) with a Unix timestamp appended.

Though the resource group should immediately appear on the Resource Groups page, it may take a few extra minutes for the resource group to appear on the Workspaces page. 

Once it does, you can select it and see the pipeline and Document Grounding inside the resource group. 

 

4. Add Document Grounding to Your Agent 

Now that the admin has set up a resource group and triggered the document grounding for a set of documents, developers of Joule Studio agents can use them in their agents.

Inside an agent, the developer can specify tools, including documents. Select Add Tools > Documents.

This opens a dialogue to specify which resource group created by the admin to use. Specify a name for the documents (as seen in the agent) and a description to help the agent know when to use them.

Then select from among the resource groups created by the admin.

Advantages

The advantages of this method are:

  • Admins and developers no longer have to work in AI Launchpad, including creating Generic Secrets and dealing with Base64 encoding of credentials.
  • Admins decide what document grounding gets used in Joule Studio agents.
    • From the look of the UI, admins will eventually be able to assign a resource group to a specific environment, giving admins even more control
  • Developers have a predefined set of  resource groups to choose from, using a dropdown list.
  • More than one AI Core instance and more than one Object Store instance can be used to define document grounding for a Joule Studio.

Note that this method creates a single document grounding pipeline in each resource group it creates; using AI Launchpad, you can create multiple pipelines in a single resource group.

There may be more advantages and limitations. Please add a comment with your opinion about this feature, or anything I missed.

entry.title: Mastering Filtering and Search Capabilities in SAP Fiori Elements for OData V4
entry.content:
What does the filter bar do in SAP Fiori elements?

The filter bar is the primary component for data filtering in SAP Fiori elements applications. It appears at the top of list report page applications and provides users with an intuitive interface to narrow down large datasets.

Key SAP Fiori elements filter bar features

  1. Automatic Generation: The filter bar is automatically generated based on your OData service metadata.
  2. Annotation-Driven: Control visibility, default values, and behavior through Core Data Services (CDS) annotations.
  3. Responsive Design: Adapts seamlessly to different screen sizes and devices.
  4. Value Help Integration: Provides dropdown lists and value help dialogs for easier data selection.
  5. Semantic Date Support: Automatic support for semantic dates like TODAY, First Day Of Week, Year To Date,‚Ä¶.
  6. Visual Filters: Support for filtering based on measure values ‚Äì for example, selecting supplier based on supplier rating or plant based on revenue.
  7. Filter Bar as a Building Block: Readily consumable in a custom page. See The FilterBar Building Block topic for more information.
  8. Leveraging AI: Allows users to submit complex queries using natural language (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition only as of January 2026)

These features are covered in-depth in the official documentation ‚Äì Configuring Filter Bars.

 

What‚Äôs in this blog for you?

I don‚Äôt intend to repeat here what is already well detailed out in the SAP Help Portal documentation.  

What I want to address in this article are some details of the search capability, along with a few lesser-known features such as support for the Clear button, custom filters, and the impact of including a filter field from a navigation entity on the query.

And, of course, how the filter bar can leverage AI capabilities.

 

How does the filter bar support search?

The filter bar, by default, includes a search bar. This will not come up if the underlying entity does not support the search capability (i.e., your entity is annotated with a SearchRestriction where Searchable=false).

A common misconception is that SAP Fiori elements controls search behavior like wildcards or fuzzy matching. In reality, SAP Fiori elements simply passes the user's search string to the back end via the $search parameter. The back end determines how to interpret and process this string.

Debugging Tip: If search isn't behaving as expected, check the network trace to verify the search string is being passed correctly. This helps identify whether the issue lies with the front-end or back-end implementation.

So next time your search is not working as expected, you are expected to raise a ticket to the right component rather than SAP Fiori elements  üôÇ

One exception: There are a few characters that SAP Fiori elements for OData V4 ignores and does not pass to the back end. These are listed in our documentation: Enabling the Search Function.

 

How does the Clear button work in SAP Fiori elements?

Many applications would love to have a ‚ÄúClear‚Äù button to remove all selections with a single click. The way to do it now is for the user to manually clear out the values from each and every filter field. For an usage scenario that requires regular clearing of all filter values before new ones are applied, this is both time-consuming and poor user experience.

SAP Fiori elements for OData V4 allows exactly this ‚Äì the ability to clear all filter fields with a single click. For more details, see the V4-specific section "Adding a Clear Button‚Äù of Adapting the Filter Bar. It even allows application developers to add some custom logic when the clear is invoked - via the onAfterClear() controller extension method.

 

How does filtering on a filter field from a navigation entity work in SAP Fiori elements?

As detailed out in the page Adapting the Filter Bar, the filter bar in the list report page supports filter fields coming from the navigation entity, both 1:1 as well as 1:n navigation entities. When a value is added to such a field, the main entity records having at least one navigation entity record with the given value for the filter field from the navigation entity are part of the result set ‚Äì the rest are filtered out. So far, so good üôÇ

Handling of multiple fields from a navigation entity

Now, consider a use case where you want to filter on the main entity records (‚ÄúTravel‚Äù) with several filters applied on fields from the navigation entity (‚Äú_Passenger‚Äù). Let‚Äôs say you want to roll out a special discount for all ‚ÄúLufthansa‚Äù travels that had at least one >60, female as a passenger.

Expected Result: Travels with passengers who are BOTH female AND over 60

Here‚Äôs how you would go about adding filter values:

  • Travel.Carrier (=‚ÄùLufthansa‚Äù)
  • Travel._Passenger.Age (>60 years)
  • Travel._Passenger.Gender (=‚ÄùFemale‚Äù)

Once the query runs though, you are in for a slightly unpleasant surprise!

Actual Result: Travels with (any female passenger) AND (any passenger over 60)

Why does this happen?

The reason is that SAP Fiori elements combines each filter field with an AND operator. This works fine with main entity filter fields but when there are multiple filter fields from a navigation entity, the regular and routine AND handling leads to a result that is a bit counter intuitive.

Current Query Generated:

$filter=Carrier eq 'Lufthansa'  

       and _Passenger/any(L1:L1/Age ge 60)  

       and _Passenger/any(L1:L1/Gender eq 'F')

 This leads to all ‚ÄúLufthansa‚Äù travel records that have at least one passenger above 60 years and at least one passenger of female gender. Note that the passenger record that matches the ‚Äúabove 60 years‚Äù and the passenger record that matches the female gender may not be the same here.

The expected query that matches the intended outcome would have been:

$filter=Carrier eq 'Lufthansa'

     and _Passenger/any(L1:L1/Age ge 60 and L1/Gender eq 'F')

Possible workaround

One option could be to make use of custom filters to achieve this ‚Äì this is quite some effort and needs careful consideration (see next few sections). Another potential way out would be to enable use of the AI-assisted easy filter feature, detailed in the next section, once it is enhanced to handle such complex queries.

 

How does SAP Fiori elements leverage AI capabilities?

The AI-Assisted Easy Filter is one of the ‚Äúbase‚Äù i.e., non-premium AI features offered by SAP Fiori elements ‚Äì but ONLY for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offering at the moment.

It allows users to query via natural language, which is way more intuitive and easier than filling each filter field manually. This has big potential to save time, since the end user needs to only query in natural language and the framework takes the onus of breaking down the complex conditions into the required $filter query.

No commitment but the rumour out there is that there are plans to enhance it with the ability to handle complex queries like the one in the Travel & Passenger example above üôÇ

Watch AI-Assisted Easy Filter Demo

 

When to use custom filters in SAP Fiori elements?

By default, all filterable fields of the main entity are shown in the filter bar of the list report page. One filter field = one filterable property. And one simple condition using any of the standard operators (=, >=, <=, between, contains, startsWith,‚Ä¶ and so on) depending on the filter field configuration ‚Äì Configuring Filter Fields talks more about the various filter restrictions that one can set.

But what if you need a much more complex condition than what we offer by default? SAP Fiori elements allows applications to add their own custom filters. This can be useful in two scenarios:

  1. When you need a different -presumably better- visualization for the filter field. For instance, you would like something closer to a rating indicator rather than a dropdown showing different values for a rating filter.
  2. You need a more complex condition ‚Äì like those mentioned under the V4-specific section ‚ÄúCustom Filters with Custom Operators‚Äù of Adding Custom Fields to the Filter Bar page.

Important: When defining custom filters with multiple properties, ensure proper handling of filter conditions to avoid unexpected query behavior. The documentation provides detailed guidelines for common pitfalls.

If you choose to add the custom filter fields, consider using the SAP Fiori tools ‚Äì Application Modeler extension to generate the fragment and handler files and automatically register them in the manifest so that appears at the desired position in the filter bar. You can then focus on the intended logic by substituting the placeholder content in the fragment file with your own code.

 

5 steps to optimizing filtering capabilities in SAP Fiori elements

SAP Fiori elements for OData V4 provides comprehensive filtering and search capabilities that significantly enhance user productivity and application performance. By understanding and properly implementing these features, developers can create intuitive, efficient applications that meet business needs while minimizing custom code.

The key to success lies in:

  • Leveraging metadata-driven annotations
  • Implementing performance-optimized filters when implementing your own conditions via custom filters
  • Creating user-friendly filter layouts when creating your own UI fragments for custom filters
  • Testing with realistic data volumes
  • Following SAP Fiori design guidelines

Whether you're building a simple list report page or a complex analytical application, mastering these filtering and search techniques will help you deliver applications that users love and that perform efficiently at scale.

 

Additional Resources

  • SAP Fiori Design Guidelines: https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design/
  • SAPUI5 SDK: https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/ 
  • SAP Fiori development portal: https://sapui5.hana.ondemand.com/test-resources/sap/fe/core/fpmExplorer/index.html#/topic/introducti...
  • SAP Community: https://community.sap.com/topics/ui5 
  • OData V4 Specification: https://www.odata.org/documentation/

entry.title: Chapter 2 || SAP Joule: Interaction Patterns of SAP Joule
entry.content:
SAP Joule Series:
Chapter 1 || SAP Joule: The central nervous system for Business
Chapter 2 || SAP Joule: Interaction Patterns of SAP Joule

Joule Capabilities are categorized into different Interaction patterns.

1. Informational Interaction Pattern:

The informational pattern provides knowledge-based results. These are, for example, policy-related questions. This can be based on SAP-owned content, such as SAP Help Pages, or could be a customer-owned content as well, by integrating the SAP Document Grounding services with Joule.

 

 

2. Navigational Interaction Pattern:

Joule makes it easy for users to reach the right SAP application or screen, so they can manage business processes on their own. With Joule, users can jump straight to what they need, which is ideal for those who aren‚Äôt familiar with SAP‚Äôs navigation.

 

3. Transactional Interaction Pattern

Joule gives users a direct entry point to access SAP‚Äôs backend systems. They can start and manage business processes just by using natural language and generative AI. For example, reviewing and approving purchase orders, creating new job postings, or handling any other create, read, update, or delete tasks. All the SAP's cloud products are now building content packages for Joule to support the most essential interactions for the users.

 

4. Analytical Interaction Pattern

This pattern aims to provides insights and data analysis capabilities. Users can ask questions related to business metrics, trends, and performance indicators, and Joule will provide relevant insights from the SAP Analytics Cloud system.

entry.title: Re: store credentials for destination in MTA file
entry.content: Don't create backend destinations via the mta but create them manually through the BTP Cockpit. Such credentials could get rotated (change of password) and/or shared with other apps needing access to the same backend, so best maintain them centrally (BTP Cockpit) instead of specifying them in a single app's mta.

entry.title: Re: Getting error when opening excel file using GUI download
entry.content: This issue typically occurs because the Excel file generated via SAP GUI Download contains structural inconsistencies that newer Excel versions validate more strictly. When Excel detects unreadable or invalid XML content (often related to PivotTables, formatting, or internal relationships), it triggers a repair process on open, which can result in removed or broken components. This is not strictly an SAP issue but an Excel compatibility and validation problem. A common workaround is to keep the export as a simple flat table and avoid complex Excel features in the generated file, or rebuild those features after download. If the file is already impacted and Excel‚Äôs built-in repair is not sufficient, repairing the workbook structure using a third party tools like Stellar Repair for Excel can help restore the file and prevent further crashes or data loss.

entry.title: Re: Cloud Integration - JMS Queue - Entries Number
entry.content:
Hola Fellipe,

I hope I'm not off topic, but I'm certainly late.

I've just struggled with something similar, especially since when SAP brought back the good old "pipeline" concept, belonging to SAP PI/PO and missing in Integration Suite.

First of all, you can find all answers by calling this: https://<your-btp-host>/api/v1/$metadata (see attached).

Then, the "right" entity is simply Queues, not JmsQueue, which doesn't exist and comes back with a 501 HTTP response, bad. The response (ATOM) is quite detailed (see attached).

Then you can drill down: https://<your-btp-host>/api/v1/Queues('YourQueueName')/Messages

In the response you should  (haven't tried it yet) find 

  • Msgid

  • Failed: boolean (true o false).

    If you wanna get rid of failed messages:

     

    • Method: DELETE

    • URL:

      Plaintext
      https://<your-btp-host>/api/v1/JmsMessages(Msgid='MSG_ID',Name='YourQueueName',Failed=true)
       
      If you want to reprocess (push) the failed msg, sorry: I still need to investigate but I have a feeling that a bridge http->jms  iFlow could be necessary (given it's a HTTP POST).
       
      Hope this helps. You and the Community.
       
      BR
       
      Alex

entry.title: The Integrated Toolchain in a Nutshell
entry.content:
Part three of the five-part series, ‚ÄúRISE with SAP Methodology‚Äù

If cloud ERP programs were judged purely by technology choices, most would look successful on paper. Platforms are modern. Architectures are sound. Road maps are ambitious.

Yet for many organizations, the lived experience tells a different story. Ask any experienced SAP solution admin or transformation lead where time and energy are really lost, and the answer is almost always execution. Teams fight more with coordination than configuration. Customers often describe it painfully clearly: ‚ÄúWe spend more time aligning than delivering.‚Äù Fragmentation creeps in where continuity should exist across collaboration, handoffs, rework, and alignment cycles.

This is exactly the challenge RISE with SAP Methodology is designed to address. With the integrated toolchain at its core, the methodology establishes a connected execution backbone that keeps process, architecture, testing, quality, and adoption moving forward together (as shown in the figure).


Figure: The integrated toolchain within RISE with SAP Methodology


How a single transformation backbone is created

The integrated toolchain helps transform ERP landscapes toward SAP Business Suite by orchestrating change holistically across people, processes, applications, and data.

It consists of a variety of solutions that work together to connect design, execution, governance, and long-term operation across the transformation lifecycle:

  • SAP Signavio solutions provide transparency into how business processes run and support fit-to-standard decisions and continuous improvement
  • SAP LeanIX solutions create clarity across the application and integration landscape, supporting a clean core approach and architectural governance
  • SAP Cloud ALM acts as the central system of record for execution, connecting scope, requirements, milestones, risks, testing, and cutover
  • SAP Build solutions enable controlled extensibility and innovation and keep the digital core standardized and upgrade-safe
  • SAP Integration Suite governs and automates integrations across SAP and third-party solutions
  • SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing solution by Tricentis introduces process-driven, automated testing
  • SAP Advanced Data Migration and Management software by Syniti supports early and structured data cleansing, validation, and transformation
  • SAP Archiving and Document Access application by OpenText helps reduce the data footprint and preserve compliance and access to historical documents
  • WalkMe solutions support adoption by guiding users directly in the solution as processes evolve

Collectively, this integrated toolchain enables continuous upgrades, delivers on clean core strategy expectations, accelerates business change, and maintains execution discipline.

A shared system of record is created, one where decisions are made once, documented once, and reused everywhere they matter across phases, teams, and roles. Processes, architecture, requirements, testing, data, integrations, and adoption progress as one connected flow, instead of parallel workstreams hoping to stay aligned.

 
A customer transformation example: Where continuity happens in practice

Suppose a global company is embarking on its move to SAP Cloud ERP Private through the RISE with SAP journey. The goal is not to replicate the past in a new environment, but to simplify processes, reduce customizations, and create a foundation that can evolve over time.

The transformation starts with understanding, not a configuration. While new SAP customers start directly in the discover and onboarding phase with the digital discovery assessment toolkit using the SAP Cloud ALM solution, installed-base customers start with understanding their current state.

Using SAP Signavio solutions, the company‚Äôs team gains factual insight into how business processes actually run across regions, highlighting variations, bottlenecks, and improvement potential. In parallel, SAP LeanIX solutions provide visibility into the existing architecture, application landscape, integrations, and dependencies, while the SAP Readiness Check toolset delivers technical insight into custom code and required simplifications.

With this clarity established, execution gains structure. SAP Cloud ALM becomes the central orchestration layer where scope, requirements, milestones, risks, and responsibilities are documented and connected.

Decisions made in workshops no longer disappear into slide decks‚Äîthey are traceable, actionable, and visible across teams. Data is addressed early using SAP Advanced Data Migration and Management, and SAP Archiving and Document Access helps define which historical data and documents need to remain accessible without burdening the future system.

As the program moves into fit-to-standard discussions, evidence replaces opinion. SAP Signavio solutions provide a clear reference for standard SAP processes, and SAP LeanIX solutions continuously assess the architectural impact of proposed deviations. Where extensions are justified, SAP Build enables application development in a manner that‚Äôs clean and upgrade-safe. Integrations are also defined and governed through SAP Integration Suite to help ensure transparency and resilience across the broader ecosystem.

During realization, quality becomes a continuous signal rather than a final checkpoint. SAP Cloud ALM maintains structure across delivery activities. SAP Enterprise Continuous Testing by Tricentis automates testing based on real business processes. Test results, defects, and fixes remain traceable back to original requirements, giving stakeholders a clear view of readiness and risk at all times.

As go-live approaches, cutover planning is no longer a fragile spreadsheet exercise based on assumptive narratives. SAP Cloud ALM brings together testing status, data readiness, integration stability, and archiving decisions into a single, evidence-based view. Leadership decisions about timing and risk are grounded in facts.

After go-live, the same execution backbone continues to support monitoring, stabilization, and continuous improvement. WalkMe solutions guide users directly in the system as processes evolve, while SAP Signavio and SAP LeanIX solutions keep process and architecture transparency intact as new changes are introduced.

As this story proves, the absence of fragmentation is what makes a difference when transitioning and upgrading the IT landscape. No decisions vanish into inboxes. No testing evidence lives on private drives. No critical knowledge depends on heroics. The transformation unfolds as one connected flow‚Äîfrom first insight through ongoing operations.


Why this approach works

In a cloud ERP world defined by continuous change, fragmentation is a structural risk. The integrated toolchain within RISE with SAP Methodology replaces that risk with continuity, transparency, and control.
ERP systems are inherently complex, but hidden complexity doesn‚Äôt have to accumulate unnoticed. With a connected system of execution, organizations gain one source of truth. Decisions retain their context and ownership. Testing reflects real-world business use. Clean core strategies make upgrades easier. Continuous improvement becomes possible without rework or documentation resets.

The result is not simply a successful go-live, but a transformation foundation that endures as the business evolves over the long term.

To learn more about RISE with SAP Methodology, read our in-depth overview.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What‚Äôs next?

 In the next part in our ‚ÄúRISE with SAP Methodology‚Äù series, we‚Äôll explore how guided expert support accelerates transformation with less risk and better decisions at each stage of the journey:

January 28: "Expert Guidance: Your Guided Transformation Accelerator"

Revisit our previous blogs and stay tuned for the rest of the blog series, too:

  • Part 1: RISE with SAP Methodology: A Practical Guide to Modernizing with Confidence
  • Part 2: Deep Dive: Inside the Framework of RISE with SAP Methodology and Its Connection to SAP Activate
  • Part 4: Expert Guidance: Your Guided Transformation Accelerator (coming January 28)
  • Part 5: The Combined Power of SAP Business AI and RISE with SAP Methodology (coming February 11)

 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

#clouderpprivate #s4hanacloud #sap #risewithsap #transformation #risewithsapmethodology

entry.title: Re: Push from the (customer) Account general menu a field...
entry.content:
Dear requester,

I suppose you are questioning about the ABC Classification field in the Account master data - General tab. This is the standard field.
In the sales order, when entering an account, the account ID/name and address information (as well as the contact) is then determined and filled in the sales order. But the other attributes like ABC Classification is not taken/shown. This is the current design. And there is no option to make the standard field to be shown in the sales order currently.

If it is critical for your sales order documents, you can create an Extension Field in the Account master data and maintain the same value. Then enable the extension scenario from account master to sales order. Afterwards, when you creating a new sales order and entering the account, the extension field will fetch the value from account master data and show it in the sales order.

Hope this answers your question.

Thanks,
Adie
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP Analytical Reports G\L Accounts Goods Receipt/Man...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

You may want to try out the following procedure:

  1. Use the Custom CDS Views app to create a new CDS view that aggregates production quantities. This view should not include G/L account dimensions.
  2. Select a data source that contains production data (production orders, material movements...) and aggregate the data to get total production in kilos and total quantity.
  3. In the next step, use the Custom Analytical Queries app to create a new query that is based on the CDS view you created.
  4. In the query, the production quantities should be displayed as separate rows; set them as measures and don't associate them with any G/L account dimensions.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: PM order and assignment to WBS element - possibilities
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the two WBS element fields in a maintenance order serve different purposes: the ‚ÄúAccount Assignment WBS Element‚Äù drives actual cost postings and settlement, while the ‚ÄúPlanning WBS Element‚Äù is used for budgeting, simulation, and organizational reporting. Yes, multiple maintenance orders can be assigned to the same WBS element to track costs centrally, but the functionality is streamlined compared to On-Premise ECM/PM integration.

Answers to Your Specific Questions

What do you do with this assignment?
Use it to link maintenance orders to projects for cost tracking and planning. The Account Assignment WBS drives settlement, while the Planning WBS supports reporting.

Is it possible to assign multiple maintenance orders to a PSP element and track costs centrally?
Yes. All orders assigned to the same WBS element will post costs there, allowing centralized tracking.

Is there a documented process/scope item/test script?
Scope Item 4VT (Improvement Maintenance) is the main reference. It shows project creation and assignment. Beyond that, SAP documentation on Account Assignment in S/4HANA Cloud and WBS Element in Service provide examples of how costs and revenues flow into WBS elements.

entry.title: SAP Business One Service Layer ‚Äì Copy From Landed Cost to A/P Invoice (BaseType 69 Not Supported)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on SAP Business One 10.0 using the Service Layer (v2) to automate broker invoice posting as part of an AI / Agentic Automation application.

Business Scenario (GUI)

In SAP GUI, users:

  • Open A/P Invoice

  • Click Copy From ‚Üí Landed Cost

  • Select the broker Landed Cost
    SAP automatically:

  • Creates the A/P Invoice

  • Builds the Relationship Map link between Landed Cost and the invoice

API Scenario (Service Layer)

Using Service Layer, I:

  • Retrieve the Landed Cost via /LandedCosts

  • Create the broker A/P Invoice via /PurchaseInvoices

When I attempt to link the invoice line using:

  • BaseType = 69 (Landed Cost)

  • BaseEntry = <LandedCost DocEntry>

SAP returns the error:
‚ÄúBaseType 69 is not valid‚Äù

From my research, Service Layer does not support ‚ÄúCopy From Landed Cost‚Äù, and no relationship is created in the Relationship Map when posting via API.

Questions

  1. Is there any supported way to create a Landed Cost ‚Üí A/P Invoice relationship using Service Layer?

  2. If Service Layer does not support this, what is the recommended enterprise approach?

    • DI API / SDK add-on?

    • Referenced Documents?

    • Any other SAP-supported pattern?

  3. How do customers usually automate this process while preserving the Relationship Map, especially in AI or RPA-driven solutions?

Any guidance or best practices would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,
Zain

 

@ANKIT_CHAUHAN 

@Chris1973 

@Lakshmipathi 

@dawid90

entry.title: Re: Happy New Year 2026! Got a minute? Tell us what you think!
entry.content:
I want not to be disrespectful, nor offend you, I understand you do your work the best possible, but I will not invest my work time (nor my free time) in a site I gave up years ago.

I keep coming because sometimes the search works, but just a little better than any of my IAs. I'm sick (not tired, sick) of the many times SAP (not you, the company you work for, I mean the people who decide about this site) has changed things here leaving a mess behind.

The main problem of this site is the massive amount of wrong information it holds, and its inhability to filter and/or delete it. The gamification (and I love gamifications), the badges and other "self-promotion" things it gaves make some people to force their way into those things, by been over-active posting repetitive content or, even worse in some cases, wrong one.

Then you have the mutability: it seems this site is unable to find its identity: not just aesthetic, but functional too. It evolves from classical forum to something that I cannot define, then goes backwards to the forums but losing part of its features, and all those steps while making announcements about aesthetics that some people (at leass I do) do not care or did not asked for.

Meanwhile, the useful features we've lost are still in the void (like the one who allowed me to follow people and been noticed about their new content), the structure becomes more and more difficult to navigate.

Where could I find the ABAP questions board if I would try to help people again? Dunno, and don't care, because I gave up, because the excessive "politeness" this place must keep (and I understand it, no complains).

The site is too intrusive: if I want specific alerts, most of the time I end with an excessive amount of them. Not sure if someone fixed it and now the messages can be massively deleted, but I gave up on them and decided to stop monitoring things.

The last time I tried to post a suggestion, I spent a lot of time redacting the post to be well-mannered and all those things, and when I've got happy enough, I pressed the publish button and then the site told me I could not post there. Not remember the board (one of the community ones). If I will not be able to post, why do the site provides me a "new" button in the first place?

Too much time wasted and too much frustrations for me to try to keep trying, sorry. I just come here for the fast food, the wrong answers hoping they have a hint towards the good direction and because ... not sure how to explain it, maybe you call it "remote tiny sceptic hope".

Again, I wish I did not offend you nor anyone whith hope and/or good intentions for this place. I spent much more time writing this because your kind consideration towards us, but I will not go further, sorry.

entry.title: Re: Project Cost Report does not display actual costs?
entry.content:
There is no customizing in Public Cloud for this ‚Äî it‚Äôs controlled by scope item activation and master data setup. If you see costs in line-item reports but not in F2513, it usually means:

  • The WBS is not linked to a proper project definition, or
  • The project/WBS is not in released status, or
  • The wrong WBS field (planning vs. account assignment) was used.

entry.title: What‚Äôs New in SAP Warehouse Logistics: Year-End 2025 Feature Highlights
entry.content:
2025 was a great year for SAP Warehouse Logistics, the mobile app for SAP Logistics Management. At the end of the year, we rolled out powerful new features designed to make SAP Logistics Management on mobile more intuitive. Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new compared to previous versions:

  • Work Queues: Leverage work queues to receive and organize workload efficiently.
  • Pick by Deliveries: Start picking by scanning the outbound delivery number for faster operations.
  • Exception Handling: Change quantity and destination during picking for maximum flexibility.

Let‚Äôs deep dive into these features:

Work Queues

You can now leverage work queues to receive and organize your workload efficiently.

What‚Äôs new: You can either work on your default work queue or temporarily switch to any other queue as needed.

On the Home Screen, you‚Äôll be prompted to select your default work queue. Alternatively, you can change it anytime in Profile & Settings -> Queue section.

Both options display a list of available work queues in the warehouse. You can search by text or scan the queue name to select the queue you want to work in.

Why it matters: This flexibility helps the logistics clerk to distribute tasks and the warehouse operative to prioritize tasks and adapt quickly to changing operational needs.

      

Once a default queue is selected, simply tap ‚ÄúNext Task‚Äù. You‚Äôll see an overview of the next picking task in the work queue and can start the task immediately. 

      

If you‚Äôre asked to work on another queue, no problem! Use the ‚ÄúQueues‚Äù entry point on the Home Screen. From there, you‚Äôll see a list of all queues in the warehouse. You can search or scan the queue name, then tap ‚ÄúStart Queue‚Äù to begin. You‚Äôll get an overview of the next picking task within this queue and can start right away.

       

Pick by Deliveries

Picking by deliveries is now possible in the new release.

What‚Äôs new:

  • On the Home Screen, you‚Äôll find a new entry point called ‚ÄúDelivery‚Äù.
  • From this entry point, you can search or scan the delivery number.
  • Once selected, all open tasks related to this delivery will be displayed.
  • You can then choose one task and start picking immediately.

Why it matters: This feature streamlines the picking process for delivery-based workflows and is especially helpful for the so called ‚Äúsingle order picking‚Äù. It does reduce errors and consolidation efforts and with this ultimately improves efficiency.

      

Exception Handling

Handle unexpected situations during picking without interrupting your workflow.

What‚Äôs new:

  • During picking, if you find that an item is missing and you cannot pick the full required quantity, or if the destination bin is full and you cannot drop items there - no worries!
  • You can now adjust the quantity and/or change the destination bin directly during picking.
  • For example: If 5 bags are required for a specific warehouse task but you only find 4 bags, simply change the quantity to what you actually picked. Also, if the destination bin is full, you can confirm the drop-off at an alternative destination bin.
  • Changes during warehouse task execution are clearly marked with ‚ÄúCHANGED‚Äù labels, so you can easily identify modified quantity and destination.  

Why it matters: This feature gives you flexibility to handle exceptions during warehouse task execution quickly, ensuring smooth operations and accurate inventory updates.

     

Which feature do you love most? Or what would you like to see next? Share your thoughts!

Further Information

SAP Logistics Management Product Page

SAP Logistics Management What's New Viewer

entry.content: I agree, we found that with the generic ODBC driver and with Microsoft datastore type, Data Services is capable of authenticating with service principal and reading (with good performances and no issues), but for writing there is a big problem, every row inserted before commit creates a parquet file with big performance bottlenecks. entry.title: Manage Workforce App Limitations When Integrating Employees from SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Dear Expert.

We are reviewing the employee information interface between SAP SuccessFactors and SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
According to Note DIGITS, it is mentioned that if the following communication scenarios are active, the ‚ÄúManage Workforce‚Äù app cannot be used to create employees in certain cases :

  • SAP_COM_0001 (JB1)

  • SAP_COM_0301 (Replicate Basic Master Data for Workforce from External HR Systems)

  • SAP_COM_0575, SAP_COM_0594, SAP_COM_0659 (Master Data Integration)

We would like to verify the technical limitations of the Manage Workforce app when receiving employees from SuccessFactors.

  1. Is it possible to create users directly in Public Cloud independently of the users received via interface?

  2. If the employees received via interface do not have bank information, can this information be added or updated afterward?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Manage Workforce App Limitations When Integrating Emp...
entry.content:
For the First issue, Is it possible to create users directly in Public Cloud independently of the users received via interface?

Yes, it is possible to create an user directly in the S/4HANA System via the application "Manage Workforce". But if you are using any other channels like SOAP API, MDI or JB1 or any other channels it is advised as per SAP to use one channel to create and update the Worker with the same channel. In that case all the creation and updation will be done via that specific channel and not via any other channel or directly via the app.

Please refer to the below KBA for Replicating Workforce Persons Using New Integration Channels

##2813743 - What to Consider When Replicating Workforce Persons Using New Integration Channels in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

And secondly, If the employees received via interface do not have bank information, can this information be added or updated afterward?

If the Worker/Employee that you are trying to create does not have the Bank Information then also it is possible to create a Worker or such cases the information can be passed via the update payload of the Worker with the same channel with the new payload.

For an Example, if you are using the SuccessFactor option then refer the below help document to see the Bank Information is marked as optional and you can update the same Worker with the full payload with the Bank details later as per your business requirement.

What Is Payment Information? | SAP Help Portal 

 

Thanks and Regards,

SAP support.

entry.title: Re: What is the simplest, step‚Äëby‚Äëstep prepackaged approa...
entry.content:
1. Is there a single, clear document that explains the end‚Äëto‚Äëend setup (prerequisites, iFlows, connectivity, key mapping, and testing) for the prepackaged solution?
    [Answer]:  Here a documentation on how to acheive that: https://help.sap.com/docs/sisgw/sap-ariba-cloud-integration-gateway-overview-guide/integrating-sap-s-4hana-cloud-with-sap-ariba-solutions-using-sap-integration-suite?locale=en-US&version=LATEST 
  2. Can this integration be implemented without SAP Ariba Cloud Integration Gateway (CIG), or is CIG required? [Answer]: CIG is normally the integration way to go, even if you go with the Integrations Suite, you can used the iflow, but all the maintenance and update be challenging.  It is important to know that CIG is built on top of Integration Suite, so in another terms, it is a lightway version of Integration Suite and it doesn't require a separate licence.
  3. If CIG is required, do we need a separate license for CIG, and where is this licensing documented? [Answer]: No, if you have any SAP Ariba Product Licence, CIG is free of charge.
  4. Are there any differences in steps or components when integrating to S/4HANA Private Cloud vs. S/4HANA Public Cloud? [Answer]: Private Cloud require the CIG addons installation, this works exactly as on premise system. However the Public Cloud works on scope items that need to be activated and come with some communication arrangement setup. Bothe are quite different in terms of Integration.

entry.title: Re: Introduction to the Parallel Line
entry.content:
Hi everyone and thanks for the useful explanation: I have some questions.

Looking at the pre-requisites for the S4 Tenants branch.

  • Customizing tenant: Release all CBC and BC transports in the customizing tenant.
    • The copy seems to be a Local Client Copy (SID/100 to SID/120): acknowledging the best practice is to release (or in exceptional cases, discharge the modification) all transports before a copy/upgrade, this pre-requisite will be not always easy to satisfy by customers, as it implies a stop on the project activities and maintenance activities (change freeze): is there a way to lift this requirement? Technically, the copy could be performed. 
  • Test tenant: Import all transports in the import buffer of the test tenant.
    • Not all TR are supposed to be imported into TEST. Is that an effective hard-requirement and if so, why? Is there a way to lift this restriction? 

For what concerns the possible behavior of Project Line during Major Upgrades/HFC.

  • Being sitting on the same SID, Dev/080+100+120 and TST/100+120 will have same maintenance windows.
    • In case of regress test findings or pre/post activities required, what is the SAP recommendation/best practice to follow, to ensure the adjustment is deployed on both lines? Example on the IAM part and the correction activities to be performed in relation to Business Catalogs/Restrictions phased in-out: would be the export/import of the software collection from DEV/100 to DEV/120 be an option, or manual changes are expected to be applied to the each Customizing Tenant? 

Exclusions from Branch activities.

  • Master and Transactional data are intentionally excluded from the branching.
    • Can be the SAP TDR (Test Data Refresh) an option to copy content from the Productive system? 
    • Users are not copied during Branch. Will the pre-req of TDR (outnumbering workers ID) also be applicable in this scenario? 
    • Could be the PL (TST/120) together with the TDR seen as a possible combination of activities to create a Pre-Production System?

Working in a 5SL (5-System Landscape, Project and Maintenance Line).

  • After the initial branching (first deployment of Project Line), the synchronization activities are the Rebase/Merging, at CBC Level. What about the KUE/Customizing?

 

Regards, Cristian
